metadata.authority_name: Bank for International Settlements — Basel Committee on Banking Supervision

content.verbatim_text: FRTB introduces a revised boundary between the trading book and banking book, and a new standardised approach and internal models approach for calculating market risk capital. Key changes include: Expected Shortfall (ES) replacing Value-at-Risk (VaR), desk-level model approval, and non-modellable risk factors (NMRFs).
content.title: Fundamental Review of the Trading Book

structured_data.relevance_to_odgs: Market risk measurement standard — defines how derivatives and trading positions must be governed

interpretation.summary: Basel III: Fundamental Review of the Trading Book
